data.title: The Penguins of Madagascar "gone in a flash"
data.text:
Abstract

This animation represents the culmination of two years of CG development to find the optimum balance of entertaining storytelling, high-quality aesthetics, and technical innovation. This combination allows Nickelodeon to produce an 11-minute episode each week at a near-feature-level quality on a television timeline and budget.

Rigging octopuses in Penguins of Madagascar

DigiPro '15: Proceedings of the 2015 Symposium on Digital Production

On Penguins of Madagascar, we had the unique challenge of rigging several octopus characters to antagonize our heroes. Unlike normal octopuses, they spend most of their time on land, and had to be able to scurry around, operate machinery, and do kung-...

BBC iPLayer "Penguins"

SIGGRAPH '09: ACM SIGGRAPH 2009 Computer Animation Festival

Filmmaker and writer Terry Jones is the latest star to feature in an ambitious marketing trailer for BBC iPlayer. The 90-second trailer shows Terry following a unique colony of Adelie Penguins as they fly thousands of miles across the frozen wasteland ...
